posts.post_content: One thing about *Scars* drafts is that there was never any good, descent sized artifact critter. You either have the miniature replicas for cheap, the sometimes-good/sometimes-do-nothing metal craft ones and the ridiculously overcosted [razorfield thresher](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=razorfield thresher). All that I wanted was an always reliable 3/3 for 4. So I will be using this guy now, even if I'm not in black.
posts.html:

Posted By: NoobOfLore (10/23/2011 4:11:31 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
*"fail shade is fail powerleek."*   
   
Compared to what? A colorless [hill Giant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=hill Giant) is a solid card in nearly every limited environment. Dross Ripper even has a small bonus on top of that. So where is this leek in power you're refering to?
  
   
Once again, people using terms "power creep" and "power leek" fail to acknowledge that cards are measured within the context of the environment they're put into. These terms are too simplistic to have any practical use whatsoever, and I really wish people would stop spouting them mindlessly in place of making a comment with some value.

Posted By: SirZapdos (3/15/2012 1:04:00 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
For it's usefulness in either a mono-black, a B/G or a B/R (using either Green or Red for mana ramp) I definitely like this... But with a 3cmc for it's ability, it's painful to activate it's +1/+1... Compared to other cards that give +1/+1 in this way, for 1 Swamp and 2 Colourless, I'd expect something like a +2/+2 or a +2/+1. It doesn't look like something that would be used for defence. :/  
  
Still, I honestly can't say I don't like this.... I'd just be very careful in how I use it. MBS and SOM are still my two favourite sets, with NPH a very close third, so I could most definitely find a good home for a couple Rippers if I got the chance. :)
posts.html:

posts.post_content: Solid in limited, although the {2}{B} to pump is pretty hefty, in limited though a 3/3 for {4} is never a bad thing...furthermore the fact that it is an *artifact* can be both a blessing and a curse, it makes it more susceptible to removal while at the same time helps enable mechanices such as *metalcraft* and allows synergy with cards such as [Throne of Geth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Throne of Geth)
